title: [Large-Scale] Tiered Instructor Scaffolding Strategies for Collaborative Knowledge Building: Experimental, Analytical, and Evidence-Based Approaches to Strengthen Scientific Inquiry Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge (experimental design, data measurement, variable analysis) and experience using online learning platforms. Particularly requires understanding of scientific methodologies (hypothesis testing, observational recording, experimental error analysis)
context.additional_context: A collaboration-centered learning environment for strengthening science-related job competencies: emphasizes inquiry processes (observation-hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion) for solving real scientific problems. Learners systematically experience scientific thinking processes such as variable control, data interpretation, and evidence-based conclusion drawing.

learning_goals: Learners enhance scientific inquiry (systematic observation, hypothesis formulation, control of independent/dependent variables, experimental design, and execution) and problem-solving skills through group collaboration under three-tier (high/medium/low) instructor scaffolding support

Learners experience the stepwise characteristics of collaborative knowledge building via LMS discussion boards: sharing individual perspectives → question-based scientific analysis (data comparison and pattern identification) → collective in-depth inquiry (evidence collection and conclusion drawing)

In summative assessments, learners derive three or more creative solutions to complex science problems (based on real-world phenomena) per group and explain them using scientific evidence (experimental data/quantitative analysis results)

resources: LMS system (discussion board, group assignment tools)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
